Ayu gets Yuya's pants off before he can do anything, the horny loli!
15311.content:
The aftermath of this duel was quite unexpected. Through skillful use of his new Pendulum Monsters, Yuya was able to defeat Strong Ishijima in a single attack, silencing the stadium. The stunned audience did not quite know what to make of this sudden event, given how Strong Ishijima was not only a pro duelist, but also the Champion.

True, he had pulled out some strange new summon that nobody had ever heard of, but this was not exactly out of order. It was rare for a duelist to use anything other than Tributes, as only the most skilled or elite duelists even had the cards required to use other types, much less successfully. The crowd finally went wild as they accepted this, willing to see more of the amazing Pendulum Summon he had performed.

And true, maybe his swinging pendulum had helped get the audience to feel more okay with this situation, too.

Not long after, Yuya and Yuzu held a Pendulum Summon presentation. Ayu was standing as close to the glass as possible, her face almost glued to it. Futoshi was nearby, also watching, but without this much interest.

"Come on, come on..." she muttered, her eyes no longer so blank but her mind still a little fuzzy from the previous Pendulum Summon. When Yuya set up the scales with his Odd-Eyes Pendulum Dragon and his Magician of Chronomancy, her smile only grew larger, her eyes taking in the full light of the shining pendulum in the sky. A new heat filled her, flowing all the way through to her heart, and also... "It's so pretty..."

"Is it?" Futoshi asked, looking back at her. She seemed a little out of it, to be honest... "I know it looks cool, but"

Whatever he was going to say, the portly boy fell silent as the light did not fully emerge; the monsters Yuya tried to summon, for some reason, did not come out. Ayu stared at the scene, eyes widening even more than before, her jaw slowly falling.

On his side, Yuya just stared at his cards, not sure why the Pendulum Summon hadn't worked. Was it because he wasn't in enough danger yet?

Not a minute later, he was lying on the ground, completely defeated by Yuzu's Prodigy Mozart. The Action Field faded around them, much to the audience's disappointment. Ayu in particular didn't know how she felt, her mind lacking that blank feeling that felt so good earlier.

She didn't get a chance to say anything, however, as the audience proceeded to tell Yuya off for his failures, leaving shortly after. Only their small group was left, with the addition of Tatsuya, a new fan of Yuya's.

The plans were set; starting the next day, Yuya would begin a new training regimen, until he finally mastered the use of Pendulum Summons. Due to various reasons, however, everyone had to leave at once, be it due to the setting sun or, in Yuzu's case, having to help her father close You Show Duel School for the day. This left the teen alone in the Duel Arena, lost in his thoughts.

Well. Almost alone...

"Big brother Yuya!" Ayu suddenly declared, wrapping her arms around his legs from behind, just as he had thought about walking away. The poor redhead nearly tripped, as he felt the sudden weight, and turned back.

"H-hi, Ayu," he stammered, a bit confused. She wasn't normally this affectionate towards him; true, she was friendly, but she preferred to hang out with Yuzu more. A girl thing, he had guessed, but nothing that merited his pants being tugged like this.

"Your Pendulum Summon before was sooooo cool..." she said, before squealing. "Oops! I said it! I totally said it!" She was pulling harder, now, much to his unnerving. "I really liked it!"

"Y-yeah, I know you did, but..." Was it him, or Ayu was trying to climb on him? "Well, you know, I still need to practice..."

"And those new cards! They're so cool!" she added, squealing again. "That white magician looked soooooo awesome! And that black magician looked a bit scary, but he had a cool ability too!" The way she was pulling on him, his belt was having difficulties handling the strain. "Can you summon them? Please? Pretty pleeeeease?"

"I-I don't know, Ayu, I..." he stammered, managing to take a step back, barely keeping his balance as it was.

Heh. Someone is Mr. Popularity.

Don't make jokes. He needs to summon us, before it's too late.

True, but can he even listen to us?

...we can only hope.
15311.title: Yuya's New Situation.

153111.content:
Yuya didn't exactly know what was going on, what with Ayu climbing him in such a strange way and straining his pants as much as she could, but he figured doing what she wanted - summoning his Magicians - would be good enough. Their Duel Disks didn't need Action Fields to be active, after all, just for the fun of Action Duels. What could go wrong?

"Alright, I got it!" he said, turning his Duel Disk back on and activating its duel mode. Finding the cards wasn't too hard after setting it on the touchpad, and soon he had his two new prized cards in hand. "For the sake of this demonstration, I'll summon Magician of Astromancy and Magician of Chronomancy in attack mode, ignoring their summon requirements!"

"Yaaaaay!" Ayu squealed, as the two tall magicians appeared side by side, sandwiching her a little. It was a bit strange, but she felt oddly comfortable with it... especially with that white one.

Seeing as how the little redhead had finally let go of him, Yuya let out a sigh of relief. "So, are you happy now, lil' Ayu?" he asked, and she turned to face him.

"Yeah! They're so awesome! I love 'em!" she declared, about ready to hug him again. This time, at least, Yuya managed to avoid her grasp, spinning back to where the Magicians were.

Why thank you. I'm glad to hear that, said a voice behind him.

"Oh, come on, she wasn't talking about yoooOOOOUUUU!!!" Yuya only realized the oddity when he turned around, seeing his Magician of Astromancy looking like it was talking.

That's a rude thing to say, Yuya. She specifically used 'they' and ''em' in her description. Clearly, this means she was referring to us, the Magician went on, definitely talking now.

Well, if we doubted he could hear us, I think it was misplaced, the Magician of Chronomancy said, a bit amused. Hi there, kid.

"...h-hi..." Yuya stammered, sweatdropping a little. "W-why are you guys talking?"

We're Duel Spirits who inhabit your deck, the white-garbed Magician explained. We have awakened with the sway of your pendulum, and are now watching over you.

"Watching... over me?" he repeated, before shaking his head. "Why? I don't need to be watched! Especially not by weird Duel Monsters like you two!"

He certainly needs better manners, the black-garbed Magician scoffed, but was stopped by his stargazing counterpart.

He's shocked. That's a natural response, whether we want it or not. He turned to face Yuya, who was glaring at them now. Listen. What we are about to tell you has all to do with your father.

That caught his attention. "My father? What happened to him?!"

We don't know. The timeline is... distorted, the Magician of Chronomancy explained, a bit roughly. One of my powers as a Duel Spirit is to observe the flow of time, so that I may manipulate it if necessary. This is why my power undoes Trap Cards. He closed his eyes. At some point in the past... someone has altered it. I cannot be sure of when it was, or what led to this result, but I know that it's true. And so did your father, when we last met.

"My father..." Yuya was silent, and as he took a look around, so was Ayu. Her gaze seemed a bit blanker than normal, maybe, but... "So, you're saying that you are part of my deck because of him?"

Maybe. We cannot confirm anything, anymore. The Magician of Astromancy looked a little sad, as he said this. In order to handle this distorted timeline, we've unlocked the powers of your pendulum. The obvious power you've received is Pendulum Summon, but...

"But?" Yuya asked him.

As you probably know, pendulums are used for hypnosis. Your father seems to be aware of it, as he's done his best to protect you... you won't be hypnotized by your own pendulum. Using it, however, allows you to hypnotize anyone you want, for whatever reasons you may have. Both Magicians looked a little proud, as the timegazer explained things. More importantly... your Pendulum Summoning is also capable of hypnotizing people.

"What?!" Yuya cried out, shocked. "D-does that mean that... people were only saying they liked my Duel with Strong Ishijima because they were hypnotized into it?!"

The Magician of Astromancy shook his head. No, Yuya. I won't deny that the Pendulum of the Soul may have brought forth feelings they did not originally have... or that maybe your feelings came through that way... but this is not how Pendulum Hypnosis works. He walked towards Ayu, whose smile widened. You had no command or person in mind to manipulate... so it was a random pick. This girl was the only one truly hypnotized by the beauty of the Pendulum of the Soul, and she has fallen in love with you due to it.

If Yuya had drank anything recently, it'd be the best time for a double-take. "L-l-l-l-l-l-LOVE?! Ayu?! But she"

is someone who has been affected by the timeline distortions as well, the timegazer said, coldly. Maybe this is why she is so vulnerable, and why you had to be protected as well. Strong minds can resist the true weight of the hypnotic effect, but only for so long, and a mind affected by this distortion...

Yuya didn't know what to say. Ayu was Yuzu's best friend and 'little sister'; to learn she was in love with him - that she had been hypnotized to fall in love with him... it was too much. He just fell on his butt, silent for now.

The Magician of Astromancy felt it was time to move on. Your pendulums work in the following manner. Use the Pendulum of the Soul to grasp the masses as a whole, and if you're lucky a single target will take the most of it. Use your pendulum - the one hanging from your neck - to hypnotize a single person. He nodded slightly. You cannot undo a change from the Pendulum of the Soul, and certain commands cannot be followed no matter what, but other than that...

"So... I can't fix Ayu's 'love' for me?" Yuya uttered, feeling a little exhausted.

No. Not after Odd-Eyes Pendulum Dragon got to her, at any rate. That made him blink.

"What does Odd-Eyes have to do with it?" he asked them, and the two Magicians suddenly looked a lot more awkward.

...there's no easy way to put it, is there? the Magician of Chronomancy asked his partner.

It doesn't seem like it.

With that, the black-garbed Magician nodded again. Odd-Eyes Pendulum Dragon is a horny bastard who wants to hump females, he explained, as bluntly as he could be.

Yuya's brain now wanted to take a nap for a while.

It wasn't until he had seen the bright ring open above him that the redhead realized something was missing.

Yourself! both of them declared at once, and he nodded.

...%D


The next second, Yuya and Ayu were inside some sort of void, standing on a platform of some kind. "Wha... what is this place?!" the boy cried out, as he looked around. This void spread as far as he could see, with only a few paths leading out.

This is the Time Void. It is here that we can explore the past, Yuya. The Magician of Chronomancy floated down to him as he spoke those words, while the Magician of Astromancy came closer to Ayu, taking her on his hands.

"The Time Void... can we go back to our own time from here?!" Yuya asked, worried enough for the two of them.

Yes. This is merely one of the dimensions we Duel Monsters can access and exist in. You'll be returned safe and sound once we are done. The Magicians headed forward, along a given path, and Yuya went after them. Their path led to a strange light, which spiraled in front of them.

Yuya Sakaki was not having a good night's sleep.

Bump. Bump. "Big brother!"

It was one thing to have a little sister. He had found it weird to have her steal so much attention from his parents, but in a way, he didn't mind. After all, Ayu was cute as a button and the most adorable little sister ever, and he had never found a reason to be jealous. And besides, it meant his parents paid less attention to him and his goofing at school, so he didn't mind it that much.

Bump. Bump. Bump, bump, ba-bum-bump.

The problems started when his parents fell in love again. Not with each other, which the young boy might've found bearable if he knew what that'd mean, but with Ayu. And not in a weird way, but... well, raising her, now that they were a little more mature, felt a lot more interesting than raising him. So they decided to try again.

Bump. Bump-bump. "Ahn!" Bump, bump, bump-bump-ba-bump. "Ahn, ahn!"

Which meant that every night, they were busy doing Numbers 100: Numeron Dragon-knew-what in their bedroom, Which happened to be at the side of his.

"Big brooootheeeer!"

And Ayu, who used to eat any time she was hungry, now had to spend some time without drinking milk, her favorite meal of the day. Their parents had been quite clear that nobody was allowed in the room when they were doing this weird thing. Not even a hungry Ayu.

Bump. Bump. Bump.

The poor girl had matured rather well in the last few years. She was still a little sprout, according to Yuya, but she was quite smart, having become the highest graded kid in her year since kindergarten. She wasn't that popular, but nothing that a big brother support couldn't handle.

But when it came to her milk, she was never budging. She wanted it, wanted it now, and was willing to cry if necessary... or at least, she was until the week before, when her parents refused to come out no matter how loud she had been.

"AHN!"

Combining all that, little Yuya hadn't had a good night of sleep in the last few weeks. Or even the last few months.

BUMP!

"AHHHHN!"

"BIG BROTHER!"

And now all noises were too loud. Yuya groaned, before finally waking up briefly. "What is it, Ayu..."

"I'm hungry! Feed me!" she told him, still trying to shake him awake. "I need milk!"

"Ayu, I need to sleep..." he groaned, barely looking at her. "I have an exam tomorrow..."

"But I need my milk, big brother! I can't sleep!"

'And I can't sleep with you making all this noise,' he thought, shaking his head.

"Ayu, please, go away..." he muttered, already falling back asleep. Normally, Ayu might've accepted such a response and that would be that... but she was hungry and unhappy and really, really hungry.

And she wasn't going to stand for that.

With a huff, she got under his covers, pushing herself through. Yuya barely realized it until he felt her full weight on his chest, the little girl grabbing his pajama shirt and unbuttoning it. "A-Ayu! What are you !?"

"I'm! Hungry!" she growled, almost like a wild animal, before pulling it open. "I! Want! Milk!"

With a single movement, she dived on him, sucking from him as much as she could. Yuya gagged as he suddenly felt her tiny mouth latch onto such a sensitive spot, unable to call out his voice. She sucked on him for several seconds, leaving the poor boy stunned the entire time, his mind unable to comprehend what exactly was going on.

"A... Ayu..." he eventually squeezed out, his jaw almost open from how exhausted he had been from the effort. With one final lick, she let go of him, sitting up fully on her adoptive brother's chest.

"Thanks for your milk, big brother..." she said, starting to pull out her shirt. If Yuya wasn't already with a loose jaw from the sheer shock of what had happened to him, then it would have fallen to the ground now.

He knew that his little sister had taken well to his mother's milk. Hell, so had he. But... the things sticking out of her chest, perfectly shaped and undaunted by gravity, were actually completely new to him. She was... he didn't remember how old she was, right now, too stunned to remember, but... they were already as proportional on her body as his mom's were! And she was younger than him, too!

"You know... do you want some milk?" she asked, holding both breasts with her hands, pressing one of the nipples with her fingers. Such perfect pink colors, never discolored... such strong smell, now that she had pulled something out... and the way she was licking her finger... "I can give you some, big brother... Ayu can give you all her milk..."

Then she shoved one of her nipples against his mouth, in the exact same way his mother usually did.

And then Yuya couldn't remember anything.
